job_details.Functieomschrijving:
You will join the Business Technology Core track, a set of teams focused on the scalability of Deepl's business model. The focus is on enabling customers to manage their accounts and subscriptions from a single licence to large enterprises with thousands of users. This requires maintaining a software landscape that owns the identity and access management, subscriptions & billing, conversion, retention optimisation and reconciliation with our financial systems. We support this infrastructure for current and future use cases for our existing products, with the aim of anticipating and accelerating the company's revenue growth expectations through technology.

   Technologies we work with include: C#, gRPC, Kafka, Kubernetes, Postgres, Cassandra, Gatsby, Typescript

   What will you be doing at DeepL?

   The Principal Engineer will own and drive technical decisions to ensure the scalability, reliability, availability and security of our internal systems and enterprise revenue platforms within Business Technology to build, commission and deploy the technology and data infrastructure and architecture to meet business revenue growth objectives.

   By defining a path to implementation, this role should ensure that product decisions and planning are carried out in a scalable manner. The Principal will challenge implementation, ensure execution alongside management and establish a collaborative path with other tracks in the engineering organisation.

   Your responsibilities
     * Facilitate the overall architecture of our business systems across teams, system owners and engineers
     * Provide guidance on the architecture and its components through the commissioning and decommissioning of all services involved
     * Ownership of revenue data management: Data architecture, governance, data protection, etc
     * Provide hands-on technical leadership on projects with a size and scope of +5 teams
     * Helping teams plan and estimate activities
     * Supporting and challenging a realistic roadmap with team leads and product managers, challenging timelines and providing predictability of deliverables to the business
     * Mentor, develop and coach other senior software engineers, engineering managers and business leaders

   Qualities we look for
     * Significant experience in one or more of the following domains:
          + Identity & Access Management
          + Fraud prevention
          + Payments
          + Monetization, * Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities. We're more than just colleagues; we're a group of professionals with a shared mission to connect diverse cultures. Our global presence is growing-we've doubled in size nearly every year, with our employees based in the UK, Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, the US, and Japan, and we continue to expand our network.
     * Open communication, regular feedback: as a language-focused company, we value the importance of clear, honest communication. We value smooth collaboration, direct and actionable feedback, and believe that leading with empathy makes us better together.
     * Remote work, flexible hours: whether you're near or in our hubs in cities like Cologne, Berlin, Amsterdam, London, or prefer the comfort of your own home, you decide where your office is. We offer remote opportunities, flexible working hours and trust in your productivity, all in sync with your team's general locations and time zones to foster effective and seamless collaboration. Our aim is to integrate your work with your lifestyle, ensuring a balance that respects both your needs and our operational requirements.
     * Regular in-person team events: we bond over vibrant events that are as unique as our team, from local team and business unit gatherings, to new-joiner onboardings, to company-wide events that bring us all together-literally.
     * Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams-we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.
     * Comprehensive health insurance: your health comes first. With our comprehensive insurance, we'll make sure you're covered from head to toe.
     * 30 days of annual leave: we value your peace of mind. With 30 days off (excluding public holidays) and access to mental health resources, we make sure you're as strong mentally as you are professionally.
     * Annual learning budget: because we never stop learning, we've set up an annual budget for your professional development-pick a learning path which contributes to your career development and we'll back you up.
job_details.full_text:
Principal Software Engineer | Business Technology

You will join the Business Technology Core track, a set of teams focused on the scalability of Deepl's business model. The focus is on enabling customers to manage their accounts and subscriptions from a single licence to large enterprises with thousands of users. This requires maintaining a software landscape that owns the identity and access management, subscriptions & billing, conversion, retention optimisation and reconciliation with our financial systems. We support this infrastructure for current and future use cases for our existing products, with the aim of anticipating and accelerating the company's revenue growth expectations through technology.

   Technologies we work with include: C#, gRPC, Kafka, Kubernetes, Postgres, Cassandra, Gatsby, Typescript

   What will you be doing at DeepL?

   The Principal Engineer will own and drive technical decisions to ensure the scalability, reliability, availability and security of our internal systems and enterprise revenue platforms within Business Technology to build, commission and deploy the technology and data infrastructure and architecture to meet business revenue growth objectives.

   By defining a path to implementation, this role should ensure that product decisions and planning are carried out in a scalable manner. The Principal will challenge implementation, ensure execution alongside management and establish a collaborative path with other tracks in the engineering organisation.

   Your responsibilities
     * Facilitate the overall architecture of our business systems across teams, system owners and engineers
     * Provide guidance on the architecture and its components through the commissioning and decommissioning of all services involved
     * Ownership of revenue data management: Data architecture, governance, data protection, etc
     * Provide hands-on technical leadership on projects with a size and scope of +5 teams
     * Helping teams plan and estimate activities
     * Supporting and challenging a realistic roadmap with team leads and product managers, challenging timelines and providing predictability of deliverables to the business
     * Mentor, develop and coach other senior software engineers, engineering managers and business leaders

   Qualities we look for
     * Significant experience in one or more of the following domains:
          + Identity & Access Management
          + Fraud prevention
          + Payments
          + Monetization, * Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities. We're more than just colleagues; we're a group of professionals with a shared mission to connect diverse cultures. Our global presence is growing-we've doubled in size nearly every year, with our employees based in the UK, Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, the US, and Japan, and we continue to expand our network.
     * Open communication, regular feedback: as a language-focused company, we value the importance of clear, honest communication. We value smooth collaboration, direct and actionable feedback, and believe that leading with empathy makes us better together.
     * Remote work, flexible hours: whether you're near or in our hubs in cities like Cologne, Berlin, Amsterdam, London, or prefer the comfort of your own home, you decide where your office is. We offer remote opportunities, flexible working hours and trust in your productivity, all in sync with your team's general locations and time zones to foster effective and seamless collaboration. Our aim is to integrate your work with your lifestyle, ensuring a balance that respects both your needs and our operational requirements.
     * Regular in-person team events: we bond over vibrant events that are as unique as our team, from local team and business unit gatherings, to new-joiner onboardings, to company-wide events that bring us all together-literally.
     * Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams-we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.
     * Comprehensive health insurance: your health comes first. With our comprehensive insurance, we'll make sure you're covered from head to toe.
     * 30 days of annual leave: we value your peace of mind. With 30 days off (excluding public holidays) and access to mental health resources, we make sure you're as strong mentally as you are professionally.
     * Annual learning budget: because we never stop learning, we've set up an annual budget for your professional development-pick a learning path which contributes to your career development and we'll back you up.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on traditional software engineering, architecture, and system reliability for business operations (identity management, billing, subscriptions). While it mentions 'revenue growth objectives' and 'enterprise revenue platforms', there is no explicit mention or strong implication of generative AI, large language models, diffusion models, or related generative AI techniques. The core responsibilities and technologies listed align more with a senior software engineering or platform engineering role rather than a specialized AI/ML role. Therefore, it falls under the 'Ambiguous' category as it's a technical role but not clearly related to AI development as defined in the coding book.

job_tasks.justification: The role is focused on 'scalability of Deepl's business model', 'enabling customers to manage their accounts and subscriptions', 'anticipating and accelerating the company's revenue growth expectations through technology', and supporting 'enterprise revenue platforms'. This demonstrates a strong alignment with business objectives.

The role aims to support 'current and future use cases for our existing products, with the aim of anticipating and accelerating the company's revenue growth expectations through technology'. This clearly links technology efforts to business growth.
job_tasks.phrase: anticipating and accelerating the company's revenue growth expectations through technology

job_tasks.justification: The role is responsible for 'meeting business revenue growth objectives' by building and deploying infrastructure and architecture.

The role involves 'supporting and challenging a realistic roadmap with team leads and product managers, challenging timelines and providing predictability of deliverables to the business'. This highlights the need to understand and align with business needs and timelines.
job_tasks.phrase: providing predictability of deliverables to the business

job_tasks.justification: The role includes 'Ownership of revenue data management: Data architecture, governance, data protection, etc'. This directly relates to managing and structuring data.
job_tasks.phrase: Ownership of revenue data management: Data architecture, governance, data protection, etc

job_tasks.justification: The role requires the engineer to 'build, commission and deploy the technology and data infrastructure and architecture'. This is a core software development and system building task.
job_tasks.phrase: build, commission and deploy the technology and data infrastructure and architecture

job_tasks.justification: The role involves 'Facilitate the overall architecture of our business systems across teams, system owners and engineers' and 'Provide guidance on the architecture and its components'. This points to designing and overseeing software architecture.
job_tasks.phrase: Facilitate the overall architecture of our business systems

job_tasks.justification: The role requires 'hands-on technical leadership on projects with a size and scope of +5 teams', indicating significant involvement in the development and execution of complex software projects.
job_tasks.phrase: Provide hands-on technical leadership on projects

job_tasks.justification: The role involves 'defining a path to implementation' and ensuring 'product decisions and planning are carried out in a scalable manner'. This is a fundamental software development planning and execution task.

The role requires the engineer to 'challenge implementation, ensure execution alongside management and establish a collaborative path with other tracks in the engineering organisation'. This involves overseeing and guiding software development execution.

The role emphasizes 'scalability, reliability, availability and security of our internal systems and enterprise revenue platforms'. These are key concerns in operations engineering for production systems.
job_tasks.phrase: scalability, reliability, availability and security of our internal systems

job_tasks.justification: The role involves 'commissioning and decommissioning of all services involved', which is a part of managing the lifecycle of services in a production environment.
job_tasks.phrase: commissioning and decommissioning of all services

soft_skills.phrase: Mentor, develop and coach other senior software engineers, engineering managers and business leaders
value your initiatives, impact, and creativity
